column5: I decided it was time to try something different for cooking some walleye...  I had heard about bacon wrapped walleye...  And if you haven't tried it... TRY IT!!!!!!  It's really easy to make...  Just cut your walleye into bite size chunks... Wrap the chunks with a 1/3-1/2 peice of bacon... Put the wrapped chunks on toothpicks or scewers (sp)... And I put some of Mercmans BBQ sauce on em... Bake at 350 for 20-30 minutes....  Very tasty treat...
As my duck hunting buddy Don always said....you can take dog crap and wrap it in bacon and it will taste good.....
My mouth is watering. I have some Perch in the freezer that I think  will try this recipe with.
With the secret dipping sauce!!!!!!nummy nummy
Looks tasty Mike. Maybe that's the recipe to try with Ling

i have no need to "save" my walleye... i have an endless year round supply... there is only a 6-8 week stretch when i cant get "fresh" walleye cause the season is closed...  i pretty much only eat walleye... dont really like bass... and perch are too much work.....
the key was a nice sweet BBQ sauce....  Mercman sells the stuff i used... "Cattle Boyz"
Man, I'm glad I just had lunch. Definitely have to try that one, maybe Sunday if all goes well tomorrow
Dip them in a little clarified garlic butter, and  a slice of good crumbly bread and you got it made.
